lines.text: People die everyday. And for what? For nothing. What do we do? What do *you* do? You take care of the ones you think you can save. Good doctors do the correct thing. Great doctors have the guts to do the right thing. Your father had those guts.

Those men upstairs, maybe there isn't much point to their lives. Maybe they are doing a great thing for the world. Maybe they are heroes. But they didn't choose to be. You chose for them. And you can't do that, because you're a doctor, and you took an oath. I don't care if you find a cure for every disease on the planet! You tortured and murdered those men upstairs, and that makes you a disgrace to your profession!
Any time you need me, give me a call. It's Stone, as in Sharon.
What if there was hope? What would it be worth to be able to walk again? To be able to feed yourself? To go back to your old life? To be a doctor? What would you endure?
You made a moral choice and not a medical one. I guess I'm kind of surprised, that's all.
On my right I see a cop with pictures of his kids in his wallet, and on my left some guy who's taken out a gun on a city bus! I had ten seconds to make a choice. I hope I made the right one.
[repeated line]
Triphase...
You're a creepy person, aren't you?
[Guy is facing an explusion hearing due to be wrongly accused of drugs charges]

Okay, look. It seems that you believe that I am somebody who had a great career, would just suddenly throw it all away. It seems more believable to you than somebody in this hospital is covering up the death of a patient of mine who's body just seemed to disappear into thin fucking air!

[the Half-Mole stops at the top of a staircase, deep underground]
Is it down there? Well I'm not paying you until I get there.

[after a long pause and speaking for the first time]
I don't go down there
How do I know you're telling the truth?
You're still alive
[Guy hands him the money]
To the bottom and through
Something strange has happened to one of my patients...

[not paying any attention]
Now why won't this new system accept my security code?
Okay, listen...
Listen to me for fuck's sake I'm not killing anyone! I'm here because whoever did kill Claude has fucked up my life! Is Teddy here? If Teddy is here, you *have* to let me *see* him!

[after a long pause]
He's here

[as Ted writhes in pain]
How long has he been here?
Four days. We found him at the factories, he was trying to make his way back here
Okay, I just need to turn him over. Here, hold his head
[it reveals a nasty gash exposing a vertebrae]
Jesus... That's why they do the lab tests
Who's 'they'?

[not appearing to hear]
That's why they do the lab tests. Someone's using healthy subjects
Why us?
They think you won't be missed
It's Gramercy, isn't it? That's where we all go
Wait a minute, what others are you talking about?
He knows... and this motherfucker's in on it!

[he glares, warning the other man to back off]
We had a guy from the dockywards... they take the strong ones, they take men
They're playing with healthy spines... someone's cut him...

[is speaking on phone]
Judith, it's Guy. Listen. I've been shot. Listen, they're hijacking people from the hospital and using them as some sort of research... I'm pretty sure that's what Triphase is, it's a kind of research program and someone at Grammercy is working for them! Listen, there's a cop, called Stone, call him, he might believe me, Judith please pick up...
